meanings.sent1: Her emotions showed a high level of repressibility, as she kept her feelings hidden.
meanings.sent2: The therapist discussed the repressibility of traumatic memories with the patient.
meanings.sent3: The repressibility of his laughter during the serious meeting almost caused a giggle outburst.
meanings.sent4: The repressibility of the volcano's eruption was a sign of the impending disaster.
meanings.sent5: The repressibility of the spring coil made it easy to compress.

meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be repressed.
meanings.sent1: The repressibility of the information was crucial for maintaining confidentiality.
meanings.sent2: Psychologists study the repressibility of memories in understanding human behavior.
meanings.sent3: The repressibility of the music in his mind made him tap his foot unconsciously.
meanings.sent4: The repressibility of the truth was like trying to hold back a flood with a dam.
meanings.sent5: The repressibility of the secret was tested when she was asked directly about it.
